snippet: The growing outbreak of meningitis was a calamity waiting to happen — the result of a lightly regulated type of drug production that had a troubled past colliding with a popular treatment.
abstract: News analysis; nation’s growing outbreak of meningitis, linked to spinal injections for back pain, was a calamity waiting to happen, as a lightly regulated type of drug production collided with a popular treatment used by millions of Americans; steroid solution under scrutiny, contaminated by fungus, was concocted by the New England Compounding Center, a type of pharmacy that makes its own drug products, which are not approved by the Food and Drug Administration.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY, SABRINA TAVERNISE and ANDREW POLLACK

lead_paragraph: The growing outbreak of meningitis was a calamity waiting to happen — the result of a lightly regulated type of drug production that had a troubled past colliding with a popular treatment.

headline.seo: News Analysis: A Question of Oversight on Compounding Pharmacies
headline.main: In a Drug Linked to a Deadly Meningitis Outbreak, a Question of Oversight
